neighbors.name: Meinholz Farms Company Llc
neighbors.claims: Meinholz Farms Company LLC is a holding entity for the Meinholz family, owners of Blue Star Dairy Farms, a large agricultural operation in Dane County milking approximately 2,100 cows across locations in DeForest and Arlington ([dairystar.com](https://dairystar.com/stories/focused-on-results,20212)). The family has explicitly opposed utility-scale solar development in the Town of Vienna; Sherri Meinholz, a manager at the dairy, stated publicly that losing prime farmland to the Great Dane solar project would threaten the land base required for feed crops and manure spreading ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/)). In 2019, a related entity (Meinholz, LLC) litigated against the Town of Springfield regarding nonconforming use rights for a quarry on their property, demonstrating a willingness to engage in legal action over land-use regulations ([caselaw.findlaw.com](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/court/wi-court-of-appeals/2171703.html)). Family patriarch Art Meinholz, who served on the Town of Springfield Board and the Yahara Pride Farms board, passed away in January 2026, though the family remains civically active ([cressfuneralservice.com](https://www.cressfuneralservice.com/obituaries/arthur-meinholz)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owners of largest local dairy operation (Blue Star Dairy); history of litigation against municipal land-use decisions; active in agricultural leadership organizations (Yahara Pride Farms).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Sherri Meinholz or surviving family leadership immediately. Acknowledge their public opposition to the Great Dane solar project and address specific concerns regarding competition for rental land. Demonstrate how the project will not impede their manure management plans.

neighbors.profile_summary: Prominent dairy farming family with documented opposition to solar development due to land competition concerns. High influence and proven willingness to litigate land-use issues.

citations.claim: Blue Star Dairy Farms is a large agricultural operation in Dane County milking approximately 2,100 cows
citations.title: Focused on results: Blue Star Dairy Farms

neighbors.name: Kittleson Rev Living Tr, Roger I
neighbors.claims: The trust is associated with Roger I. Kittleson, a prominent local official who serves as the Town Board Chairman for the Town of Perry in Dane County ([perry-wi.gov](https://www.perry-wi.gov/?page_id=114)) ([mounthorebmail.com](https://www.mounthorebmail.com/sites/default/files/MTH47_.pdf)). While his primary jurisdiction is Perry, he is influential in county-level discussions, having advocated for broadband expansion in the region ([perry-wi.gov](https://www.perry-wi.gov/)). In his capacity as Chairman, he has presided over land use hearings and voted on permits for rural development, including frost fans and accessory buildings ([perry-wi.gov](https://www.perry-wi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/TownBoardMinutes030920.pdf)). Specific public comments regarding solar development in the Town of Vienna (where the parcel is located) were not found.
neighbors.influence_justification: Town Board Chairman for the Town of Perry; active elected official in Dane County with decision-making power over land use and infrastructure projects.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as an elected official first. Even if the project is outside his direct township jurisdiction, his influence as a peer to other Town Chairmen is significant. Frame the project in terms of infrastructure and community benefit, aligning with his history of supporting utility upgrades (broadband).

neighbors.profile_summary: Trust held by the Town Chairman of Perry, WI. Highly influential local politician with a track record of supporting infrastructure upgrades (broadband) and managing routine land use permits.

citations.title: Town of Perry Board Minutes

neighbors.name: Kelley Tr
neighbors.claims: The Kelley Trust (associated with Christopher Kelley) owns land in the Town of Vienna near the Arlington border ([mds.wi.gov](https://mds.wi.gov/View/Documents?Type=PetitionFile&ID=13690)). The Trust has previously demonstrated an interest in commercial development; in 2013, it petitioned to annex territory from the Town of Vienna to the Village of DeForest to facilitate the sale of land for a Taco Bell restaurant ([mds.wi.gov](https://mds.wi.gov/View/Documents?Type=PetitionFile&ID=13690)). This history suggests a transactional approach to land ownership rather than strict agricultural preservation. The Trust is listed on tax rolls at 7662 County Rd I ([apraz.com](https://www.apraz.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/T.-Vienna-2024-Completed-Real-Estate-Assessment-Roll-1.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Landowner with history of development-focused transactions; no evidence of broad political influence or community leadership roles found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a financial value proposition. The entity has a documented history of rezoning/annexing land for commercial use, suggesting they are open to development opportunities that maximize land value.

neighbors.profile_summary: Landowning trust with a history of petitioning for annexation to facilitate commercial development. Likely amenable to projects that offer financial upside.

citations.claim: Petitioned to annex territory from the Town of Vienna to the Village of DeForest to facilitate the sale of land for a Taco Bell
citations.title: Petition for Direct Annexation - Village of DeForest
